data.title: Novaturas Group's unaudited 2025 revenue - EUR 168M, 16.1% lower than 2024.
data.description: In unaudited figures, the Novaturas Group accumulated €168 million in consolidated revenue during the twelve months of 2025, reflecting a 16.1% decrease compared to the corresponding period in 2024.

data.title: Bloomberg & Kaiko partner to bring licensed financial data onchain for institutional tokenized markets.
data.description: Bloomberg and Kaiko have partnered to incorporate authorized financial data directly onto blockchain platforms, focusing on institutional tokenized Treasurys and repo markets. This collaboration aims to enhance transparency and efficiency in the market by providing accurate and verified information. The integration of licensed financial data on blockchain networks will cater specifically to institutional investors, offering reliable insights into trading activities. This initiative underscores the growing trend of utilizing blockchain technology in traditional financial settings.

data.title: Tetragon Financial Group's January 2026 factsheet: NAV $3,795m, NAV per Share $40.80, Share Price $15.85. Monthly return -2.6%.
data.description: In its recently released Monthly Factsheet for January 2026, Tetragon reported a Net Asset Value of $3,795 million, with Fully Diluted NAV per Share at $40.80. The Share Price (TFG NA) was noted at $15.85. Tetragon experienced a Monthly NAV per Share Total Return of -2.6% and a Monthly Return on Equity of -2.5%. This data marks the latest financial snapshot before the end of the most recent quarterly period.

data.title: Investment company AB Tewox, managed by Lords LB Asset Management, acquires a retail park in Konin, Poland that opened in 2023.
data.description: In Vilnius, Lithuania on February 27, 2026, AB Tewox, under the management of Lords LB Asset Management, announces its further expansion in the retail real estate sector in Poland. The company has acquired a retail park located in Konin, which was established in 2023. This acquisition marks a strategic move in bolstering AB Tewox's presence in the region.

data.title: Tims China celebrates 7th anniversary, partners with Air Canada for exclusive promotion in Shanghai.
data.description: In Shanghai on February 27, 2026, it was reported that TH International Limited (NASDAQ: THCH), the sole operator of Tim Hortons in China (referred to as "Tims China"), celebrated its seventh anniversary in the country on February 26.

data.title: Nikkei 225 hits historic 59,000 milestone propelled by Takaichi trade, as U.S. Dow Futures sink ahead of inflation data.
data.description: The Nikkei 225 index in Japan experienced a significant surge, reaching a historical milestone of 59,000 on Thursday and maintaining levels above 58,800 on Friday. This increase was largely attributed to optimistic sentiment following the election of Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi. Concurrently, U.S. futures indicated a probable decline for Wall Street amidst anticipation for crucial inflation data. Tokyo witnessed record highs, with the Nikkei 225 achieving an unprecedented peak of 59,000 across three successive sessions. Investor confidence was fueled by the "Takaichi trade", emphasizing faith in the Prime Minister's growth-centric policies, which are perceived to be an extension of Abenomics. These measures are anticipated to elevate stocks while devaluing the yen through the implementation of accommodating monetary policies and boosted fiscal expenditure. The appointment of Ayano Sato and Toichiro Asada to the central bank board by the government further reinforced positive sentiment, given their dovish stances that align with Takaichi's strategies. Wall Street braced for likely volatility amid these developments.

data.title: Paratus Energy (PLSV) announces cash dividend of USD 0.22 per share to shareholders.
data.description: In Hamilton, Bermuda on February 27, 2026, Paratus Energy Services Ltd. (PLSV) disclosed that its Board of Directors sanctioned a cash dividend for shareholders. The declared dividend is set at USD 0.22.

data.title: Stock futures down; Carter's expected to report $1.71 per share on $922.19 million revenue, Dell exceeded Q4 estimates with earnings of $3.89 per share on $33.38 billion revenue. Dell also issued FY27 guidance above estimates.
data.description: This morning, U.S. stock futures are trading lower, with investor focus turning to specific stocks. Wall Street anticipates Carter's Inc. (NYSE: CRI) to announce earnings of $1.71 per share on revenue of $922.19 million before market opening. After hours trading saw Carter's shares increase by 0.4% to $42.07. Dell Technologies Inc. (NYSE: DELL) recently disclosed its fourth-quarter financial results, surpassing expectations. The company reported earnings of $3.89 per share for the quarter, exceeding the estimated $3.53. Additionally, quarterly revenue stood at $33.38 billion, outperforming the market projections. For further details, visit a news website like Benzinga.com.

data.title: Paratus Energy reported $115 million for Q4, $452 million for FY 2025. Operational, financial results announced.
data.description: In Hamilton, Bermuda on February 27, 2026, Paratus Energy Services Ltd. (OSLO: PLSV) announced its operational and financial performance for the fourth quarter and full-year 2025. The Company revealed a significant achievement with $115 million reported for the quarter (totaling $452 million for FY 2025), as part of their combined segment results.

data.title: Frontline plc reported Q4 2025 results: $227.9M profit, $624.5M revenues. Sales: $831.5M older ships, $1.224B for new ships. Share dividend $1.03.
data.description: Frontline PLC reported their fourth quarter results for 2025, with a profit of $227.9 million or $1.02 per share, and an adjusted profit of $230.4 million or $1.03 per share. They declared a cash dividend of $1.03 per share and reported revenues of $624.5 million for the same quarter. They achieved average daily spot time charter equivalent earnings for VLCCs, Suezmax tankers, and LR2/Aframax tankers at $74,200, $53,800, and $33,500 per day respectively. Frontline also entered agreements to sell eight older ECO VLCCs for $831.5 million and acquire nine new scrubber-fitted ECO VLCC newbuildings for $1,224.0 million. They secured one-year time charter agreements for VLCCs at rates ranging from $76,900 to $93,500 per day. CEO Lars H. Barstad mentioned positive market momentum and capitalizing on opportunities in the tanker industry. The full story is available on Benzinga.com.

data.title: Court gives US deadline to address Bankman-Fried’s new trial. White House won’t pardon convicted FTX ex-CEO.
data.description: Amid rumors that the White House has ruled out a presidential pardon, the former CEO of FTX, who has been convicted of criminal charges, is still actively pursuing legal remedies.
